bibl.title: Two Greek Texts on Skin from Hellenistic Bactria.
bibl.note: Two documents written on skin belonging to a private collection. They presumably derive from Afghanistan and more specifically from Yousufdhara close to Bactra. - 1. Amphipolis (Bactria), late third or early second cent. BC. The record of the sum of 100 drachmas of coined silver suggests a contract. - 2. Bactria, second cent. BC. The sense of the whole text is unclear.
bibl.seg: CLARYSSE Willy and Dorothy J. THOMPSON, Two Greek Texts on Skin from Hellenistic Bactria.

Two documents written on skin belonging to a private collection. They presumably derive from Afghanistan and more specifically from Yousufdhara close to Bactra. - 1. Amphipolis (Bactria), late third or early second cent. BC. The record of the sum of 100 drachmas of coined silver suggests a contract. - 2. Bactria, second cent. BC. The sense of the whole text is unclear.
